data.title: Viking Acquisition prices $200M IPO at $10 per share
data.description:
• Viking Acquisition (VACI) priced its initial public offering of 20M units at $10.00 per unit.
  • The units are expected to be listed on the NYSE and trade under the ticker symbol "VACI.U" beginning on October 31, 2025.
  • Each unit consists of one ordinary share and one-third of one redeemable warrant, with each whole warrant exercisable to purchase one Class A ordinary share at a price of $11.50 per share.
  • The underwriters have been granted a 45-day option to purchase up to an additional 3M units.
  • The offering is expected to close on November 3, 2025.

data.title: Australia Q3 producer inflation hits one-year high, rises by 1.0% Q/Q
data.description:
Australia's Final Demand Producer Price Index ((PPI)) rose by 1.0% quarter-on-quarter in Q3 2025. This rate accelerated notably from the 0.7% increase recorded in the prior quarter, and easily topped market forecasts of a 0.8% rise.

It marked the 21st consecutive quarter of producer inflation and the fastest pace since Q3 2024, with sustained demand in the residential property sector identified as a key contributor to the accelerated growth.

On an annual basis, producer prices also ticked higher. The PPI increased by 3.5% over the year to Q3, a slight acceleration from the 3.4% gain seen in Q2. The Q2 figure had represented the softest annual increase since the third quarter of 2021.

Separate data showed, Australia’s private sector credit rose 0.6% month-on-month in September 2025, matching the pace of the previous month but exceeding market expectations of a 0.5% increase. 

The S&P/ASX 200 Index rose 0.4% to around 8,920 on Friday, snapping its three-session losing streak, buoyed by gains in gold stocks and miners on higher commodity prices. 

ETFs: (NYSEARCA:EWA), (NYSEARCA:FXA), (NYSEARCA:FLAU).

More on Australia

  • Australia's Q2 producer price index rises 0.7%, following soft consumer inflation report

  • Australia CPI slowest in four years in Q2, headline CPI at 0.7% Q/Q and 2.1% Y/Y

  • Australia's trade surplus narrows to five-year low in May, missing forecasts amid export dip

  • Australia's Q1 GDP misses estimates amid weak public spending, consumer demand, and exports

  • RBA Minutes: Rate cut signals caution, data to drive future policy

data.title: China's economic slowdown deepens as factory activity hits six-month low to 49.0 in October
data.description:
China's economic momentum continued to weaken in October, marked by a significant drop in factory activity that fell short of analyst expectations, according to the latest official purchasing managers' index data from the National Bureau of Statistics.

The NBS Manufacturing PMI plummeted to 49.0 in October 2025, a sharp decline from September’s reading of 49.8, below the market forecast of 49.6 but also marked the lowest level since April, highlighting persistent challenges facing the nation's industrial sector. A PMI reading below 50 indicates contraction, reinforcing concerns over the health of the economy.

The NBS Non-Manufacturing PMI stood at 50.1 in October, barely budging from September’s 10-month low of 50.0. This reading suggests that activity in services and construction remains fragile, offering little counterbalance to the manufacturing slump.

The NBS Composite PMI Output Index—slipped to 50.0 in October, down from 50.6 in the preceding month. This critical reading, which includes both manufacturing and non-manufacturing activity, marks a severe slowdown and the lowest level since December 2022.

On Friday, the Shanghai Composite fell 0.2% to below 3,980, while the Shenzhen Component dipped 0.05% to 13,525 on Friday, extending losses from the previous session as disappointing manufacturing data weighed on sentiment, and the offshore yuan 

ETFs: (NYSEARCA:FXI), (NYSEARCA:KWEB), (NYSEARCA:CQQQ), (NASDAQ:MCHI), (NYSEARCA:ASHR), (NYSEARCA:YINN), (NYSE:TDF), (NYSEARCA:CHIQ), (NYSEARCA:GXC), (NYSEARCA:EWH), (NYSEARCA:KBA), (NYSEARCA:YANG), (NASDAQ:CXSE), (NYSE:CAF), (NYSEARCA:CWEB), (NASDAQ:PGJ), (NYSEARCA:KURE).

Currency: (CNY:USD)

More on China markets and economy

  • China's 1.1% Q3 GDP beats forecasts on policy boost, but trade war looms

  • PBoC holds key lending rates steady for fifth straight month

  • U.S.-China trade agreement leads to lifted chip design software restrictions

  • China's trade surplus widens amid weaker exports and deeper import slump

  • China’s May CPI declines fourth consecutive month, PPI deflation eases to two-year low

data.title: Steadfast plunges as CEO steps aside amid workplace complaint probe; Tim Mathieson named acting chief
data.description:
• Steadfast Group (OTC:SFGLF) shares slipped on the Australian Securities Exchange after the insurance broker said its chief executive officer will take temporary leave amid an investigation of a workplace complaint made against him.
  • Shares of Steadfast dropped the most on record on Friday, falling 19% after Robert Kelly chose to step aside to allow an external probe into the allegations.
  • No claims against him have been substantiated so far, the company said, without providing details about the complaint.
  • Steadfast Group (OTC:SFGLF) Board appointed Tim Mathieson, CEO of Australasian Broking, to the role of acting CEO, effective immediately, and he will continue in that role until the conclusion of the investigation.

data.title: Forum Energy tops Q3 estimates; raises FY 2025 cash flow guidance
data.description:
• Forum Energy press release (FET): Q3 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.08.
  • Revenue of $196.23M (-5.6% Y/Y) beats by $1.88M.
  • Adjusted EBITDA: $23 million, up 13% sequentially.
  • Operating cash flow and free cash flow: $23 million and $28 million, respectively.
  • Share repurchases: 635 thousand shares for $15 million.
  • 2025 full year free cash flow guidance increased: $70 - $80 million.

data.title: Mobix Labs granted 180-day extension by Nasdaq to regain compliance
data.description:
• Mobix Labs (MOBX) has received an additional 180-calendar-day extension from the Nasdaq Stock Market to regain compliance with the minimum bid price requirement.
  • The company was first notified by Nasdaq that it was non-compliant with the minimum bid price requirement on April 17 and was given until October 14 to regain compliance.
  • The company now has until April 27, 2026, to meet the requirement for its shares of common stock to maintain a closing bid price of at least $1.00 per share for a minimum of ten consecutive business days.
  • Mobix Labs (MOBX) rose 6% in post-marketing trading on Thursday.

data.title: Compañía de Minas Buenaventura GAAP EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.28, revenue of $431M beats by $75.44M
data.description:
• Compañía de Minas Buenaventura press release (BVN): Q3 GAAP EPS of $0.66 beats by $0.28.
  • Revenue of $431M (+30.2% Y/Y) beats by $75.44M.
  • Buenaventura's 3Q25 consolidated silver production decreased by 3% YoY due to lower production at Uchucchacua and Yumpag, partially offset by increased production at El Brocal and Julcani.
  • Gold production decreased by 21% YoY due to decreased output at Orcopampa and Tambomayo. Copper production decreased by 24% YoY.
  • In 3Q24, all stockpiled ore was processed from El Brocal’s 2Q24 voluntary temporary processing plant suspension.
  • 3Q25 EBITDA from direct operations was US$ 202.1 million, compared to US$ 136.5 million reported in 3Q24 which excluded the sale of Chaupiloma Royalty Company.

data.title: First National Bank Alaska declares $4.00 quarterly and special cash dividend of $4.00 per share
data.description:
• First National Bank Alaska (FBAK) declares $4.00/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous.
  • Forward yield 5.84%
  • Payable Dec. 15; to shareholders of record Dec. 1; ex-div Dec. 1.
  • The company has now announced a dividend of $4.00 for four consecutive quarters.
  • Simultaneously, the board declared a special cash dividend of $4.00 per share for shareholders of record as of Dec. 1, 2025, payable on Dec. 19, 2025.
  • See FBAK Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Calix targets over 20% FY revenue growth and unveils Agentic AI expansion as platform adoption accelerates
data.description:
Earnings Call Insights: Calix, Inc. (CALX) Q3 2025

Management View

  • Michael Weening, CEO, highlighted "record revenue in our fifth quarter of sequential growth while guiding higher in fourth quarter" and described the launch of the Calix Agent Workforce, an end-to-end integration of Agentic AI, developed in partnership with Google and set to launch this quarter. He emphasized, "the ability of our customers to dominate their markets when armed with our unique and highly differentiating platform and managed services model was on full display in our results."
  • CEO Weening stated, "At Connections, we officially launched the Calix Agent Workforce, our end-to-end integration of Agentic AI into everything that we do via our third-generation platform that will launch in partnership with Google this quarter."
  • CFO Cory Sindelar reported, "During the third quarter of 2025, we delivered record revenue of $265 million, reflecting sequential quarterly growth of 10%." Sindelar added, "We set another gross margin record, our seventh consecutive quarter of margin improvement," and noted free cash flow of $27 million, with cash and investments reaching $340 million at quarter-end.

Outlook

  • The company expects fourth quarter revenue between $267 million and $273 million, which at the midpoint would represent a 2% sequential increase in revenue and reflect revenue growth of 20% for the fiscal year as compared to 2024.
  • CFO Sindelar stated, "Our non-GAAP gross margin guidance for the fourth quarter at the midpoint would represent a slight increase from the third quarter and reflects our expectations regarding customer and product mix."
  • Increased OpEx is expected due to ongoing investments in Connections and accelerated AI agent development, with a return to the target financial model anticipated by the end of 2026.

Financial Results

  • Calix reported record revenue of $265 million for Q3 2025, representing 10% sequential quarterly growth.
  • RPOs rose 2% sequentially to $355 million and were up 20% year-over-year; current RPOs grew 5% sequentially to $141 million and increased 28% year-over-year.
  • Non-GAAP gross margin reached a record 57.7%, representing a 90 basis point sequential quarterly increase.
  • Free cash flow was $27 million, marking the 10th consecutive quarter of 8-figure free cash flow.
  • Cash and investments ended at $340 million, an increase of $41 million sequentially.

Q&A

  • Joe Cardoso, JPMorgan, asked about drivers of revenue outperformance and sustainability. CFO Sindelar responded, "The overperformance is driven by a couple of things. One is just the broad-based demand that we're seeing across our customer base. But it's also a function of some of the competitive expansion of our footprint."
  • Cardoso also inquired about AI-driven innovation and international growth. CEO Weening explained that 15 years and $2 billion of investment built the foundation for current AI advances, saying, "there are -- first of all, in the existing markets, there's significant growth opportunity ahead because of the fact that we're uniquely positioned."
  • Scott Searle, Roth Capital, pressed on demand broadness and sustainability. CEO Weening replied, "It is broad-based demand. The strength of our business model is that while things can go up by segment and down by segment, it is actually up to 1,200 customers that allow us to actually drive demand."
  • Searle asked about monetization of AI agents and recurring revenue potential. CFO Sindelar noted, "The way we think about the monetization of the AI agent is not so much a separate charge for it, but an acceleration of our business model, right? So our customers will acquire subs faster."
  • George Notter, Wolfe Research, questioned direct monetization of Agentic AI. CEO Weening stated, "We are taking a direct approach on monetizing it. It's actually a matter of perspective. So there will be some elements that we charge for and then there's others that we will monetize through the -- by helping them drive gross adds."
  • Ryan Koontz, Needham & Company, asked about growth limiters and risk. CEO Weening responded, "we really don't see them with regards to limiters," while CFO Sindelar added, "the practical limiters on the business as you go and build new networks, it's permitting and labor."

Sentiment Analysis

  • Analysts demonstrated a slightly positive to neutral tone, with a focus on sustainability, growth drivers, and the practical impact of AI investments. Questions frequently explored the durability of broad-based demand and the monetization strategy for Agentic AI.
  • Management maintained a confident and optimistic stance, using phrases like "we are taking a direct approach on monetizing it" and "we feel very confident with regards to the broad-based demand, the running of the business, the talent that we have inside the company."
  • Compared to the previous quarter, management’s confidence has grown, particularly regarding AI and international expansion, while analysts remain focused on the practical realization of these growth vectors.

Quarter-over-Quarter Comparison

  • Guidance language shifted to reflect higher confidence in sequential revenue growth and gross margin improvement, with management targeting a 20% revenue increase for the fiscal year.
  • Strategic focus has evolved from laying the groundwork for AI and platform expansion to actively launching Agentic AI capabilities and signaling the start of international expansion in partnership with Google.
  • Key metrics such as revenue, RPOs, gross margin, and free cash flow all reached new records, building on momentum from Q2. Management’s tone has moved from cautiously optimistic to assertively confident.
  • Analysts continued to probe the sustainability of growth and the realization of AI monetization, consistent with the previous quarter’s focus, but with increased attention to near-term execution and international opportunities.

Risks and Concerns

  • Management identified permitting and labor as the main practical limiters to network expansion.
  • Analyst concerns centered on the sustainability of broad-based demand, competitive displacement in medium and large customer cohorts, and the timing and impact of BEAD program revenue.
  • Management addressed BEAD program uncertainty, noting, "it's still too early to determine the demand dynamics for next year other than there will be some amount versus last quarter, I thought there would be like none."

Final Takeaway

Calix management highlights record-setting revenue, robust gross margin performance, and the successful launch of Agentic AI as the foundation for continued expansion, including into international markets. With a broad customer base driving growth, strong free cash flow generation, and increasing demand for AI-driven solutions, leadership expresses high confidence in achieving targeted revenue growth and margin expansion through 2026, while remaining attentive to operational risks such as permitting and labor constraints.

Read the full Earnings Call Transcript

data.title: Arcus Biosciences prices $250M offering
data.description:
• Clinical-stage, global biopharmaceutical company Arcus Biosciences (RCUS) priced an underwritten public offering of 13.7M shares at $18.25 per share.
  • Gross proceeds are expected to be $250M.
  • The underwriters have a 30-day option to purchase up to 2.06M additional shares.
  • The offering is expected to close on November 3, 2025.
  • The stock price slumped 6% on Friday during pre-market hours of trading.
